original: 15.32. Āsavaduka, Kusalattika🔽Noāsavaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca noāsavo nakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.🔽Āsavaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca noāsavo naakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …. Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: āsavaduka kusalattika  noāsavam kusalam dhammam paṭicca noāsavaḥ na kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka  āsavam akusalam dhammam paṭicca no āsavaḥ na akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: The Chapter on the Conditions in Triads🔽With an object that is not a contaminant and is wholesome, there arises an object that is not a contaminant and is not wholesome, by way of root-cause condition. With root-cause, there is one. … With non-adversion, there is one.🔽With an object that is a contaminant and is unwholesome, there arises an object that is not a contaminant and is not unwholesome, by way of root-cause condition. With root-cause, there are three. … With non-adversion, there are three.

original: Noāsavaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nanoāsavo naabyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …. Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: noāsavam abyākatam dhammam paccayā na noāsavaḥ na abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With an object that is not a contaminant and is indeterminate, there arises an object that is not a contaminant and is not indeterminate, by way of root-cause condition. With root-cause, there are three. … With non-adversion, there are three.
